intro: Euryops pectinatus, commonly known as the yellow starbursh, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Euryops pectinatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
